commentary: Beautiful, soulful, Qawwali by Maulvi Haider Hassan Vehranwale and group.
In this Qawwali, we see how the Sufi's devotion and single minded focus on Khuda transcends religious labels, tribalism, and attachment.

Equating such a devotee to a drunkard, and the devotee's teacher as the tavern keeper; the state of fana (or egolessness) is thus described as an ecstasy obtained by a rare few - and often misunderstood by society.
footnotes: [1] Reference to Punjabi folk love story Sassi-Punhun.
lyrics: madhosh...
The tavern-keeper has intoxicated me with a single cup of wine.
din...
He has snatched my body and soul, leaving me utterly defenseless.
niqab oske ult kar...
By the lifting of the Veil, this secret was revealed to me.
yaha par khatam ho jati hai...
That beyond this point, the boundaries of faith and disbelief are meaningless.
ajab andaz tujh ko nargis e mastana ata hai
O sly narcissus, what strange wiles you possess!
eh har hoshiar ban ne ko, ethe deewana ata hai
That wise men come to you, seeking the gift of madness!
koi zahid ho...
The pious and the preachers, all rush impatiently towards you.
samaj me...
Whoever deciphers the mysteries of the wine and the cup:
vo hi masjid se uth kar jaani be mekhana ata hai
Sneaks away from the mosque and heads to the tavern!
haqiqat mai nigahe dekh lai ti hai haqiqat ko
In truth, the seeing eye can visualize the eternal Truth.
chupa sak te nahi...
The abundance of creation cannot hide the unity of the Creator!
zamana kya samaj sakta hai oske kuffar ulfat ko
The world can scarce comprehend the blasphemies of Love.
nazar...
The Love that makes the Beloved manifest in the face of every idol!
kari hai...
In my intoxication, I have made so many prostrations in the temple of the idols.
mujhe kafar lage kehne musalmana ki basti mein
That in the community of Muslims, I am known as the Infidel.
nazar ati nahi kuch apni hasti apni hasti mein
I see nothing of my Self, when I peer inside myself.
My heart has ensnared me so deeply in the ways of idolatry.
jidar jatha ho mere samne buth-khana ata hai
That I see the Idol's temple, whichever way I turn!
jehre pase sasri...
Whichever way poor Sassi turns, she sees Punnu Khan before her. [1]
har ik...
Baqir, not every diver can emerge from the sea with the pearl of knowledge.
nahi is raha mein...
In this path, it is well-nigh impossible to achieve the heart's desires.
kabi gulshan mein...
Flowers are always accompanied by thorns in this garden.
na guzrein kuffar...
One cannot aspire to faith without navigating the labyrinth of doubt.
pehle to haram ki raha mein buth-khana ata hai
For on the way to the mosque, one must first pass through the temple.
na hasil...
Be it the wilderness or civilization, my heart cannot find peace.
mulandi...
I can dwell neither on lofty height, nor in sunken depths.
kabar nahi...
In my worship of Love, I have lost all sense of space and time.
When the veils of my sweet intoxication lift for a brief moment:
na jane kiski hasti dekhta hu apni hasti mein
I do not recognize the person masquerading as me!
mein ho vo rind meri zindgi mekhane mein guzri
I am the drunkard whose entire life was spent in the tavern.
meri izat...
I was highly respected amongst the mystics, preachers, and the jurists.
meri...
By my graveside, even the tavern-keeper uttered a prayer:
khuda bakshe bahut achi guzari...
May the Lord bless him, for he lived a life of intoxication, and lived it well!
In my heart burned the hidden flames of separation.
nazar si char su...
I was aware of the moment the angels came to collect my soul.
Upon seeing me in Paradise, its beauteous inhabitants exclaimed in surprise:
ye kafir kyon chala aya musalmano ki basti mein
'Who let this infidel inside the dwelling-place of Muslims?'
